alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 05 at 2:06AM PST until January 06 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 10 PM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Cascades and Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades. This includes Diamond lake, Crater Lake, Union Creek, and all major passes along Interstate 5 and highways 66, 140, 62, 138, 230, and 58. * WHEN...From 4 AM to 10 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Heavy snow and low visibilities due to blowing snow may result in hazardous travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is a greater than 70 percent chance for 1 inch per hour snowfall rates along the Cascades and in portions of the Siskiyous late Friday night into early Saturday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. Do not detour during winter storms. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades
